data.scheme_name: Credit Guarantee Trust Fund Scheme For Micro And Small Enterprises (CGTMSE)  - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides guarantee on credits for loans up to Rs. 500 Lakh, without third-party guarantee and collateral.
data.eligibility: All existing Micro and Small Enterprises engaged in manufacturing or service or trading activity are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Credit facility is standard and regular (not SMA) as per RBI guidelines. 
  2. The business or activity of the borrower for which the credit facility was granted has not ceased. 
  3. The credit facility has not wholly or partly been utilized for adjustment of any debt deemed bad or doubtful of recovery, without obtaining a prior consent in this regard from the Trust. 
  4. The Applicant should not be NPA (Non-Performing Assets).
data.beneficiaries: All existing Micro and Small Enterprises engaged in manufacturing or service or trading activity are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Credit facility is standard and regular (not SMA) as per RBI guidelines. 
  2. The business or activity of the borrower for which the credit facility was granted has not ceased. 
  3. The credit facility has not wholly or partly been utilized for adjustment of any debt deemed bad or doubtful of recovery, without obtaining a prior consent in this regard from the Trust. 
  4. The Applicant should not be NPA (Non-Performing Assets).
data.nodal_agency: Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for Micro and Small Enterprises
data.context: CGTMSE has been set up to strengthen credit delivery system and facilitate flow of credit to the MSE sector.
data.objective: To make available collateral-free credit to the micro and small enterprise sector.
data.description:
1. Credit guarantee for loans up to Rs. 500 lakh, without collateral and third party guarantee. 
  2. Women entrepreneurs/ SC/ST/ Person with disability (PwD) Borrowers would be given the discount of 10%. 
  3. Guarantee to the MSEs promoted by Agni veers shall also carry 10% relaxation in Annual Guarantee Fee. 
  4. Units in North East Region (including Sikkim) up to Rs 50 lakh would be given discount of 10%. 
  5. MSEs situated in Aspirational District would be given discount of 10%. ZED Certified MSEs would be given discount of 10%. 
  6. An MSE falling in all the above three categories viz. Social, Geographic, MSE Status shall be eligible for maximum discount of 30%.
data.how_to_apply: Candidates meeting the eligibility criteria may approach banks / financial institutions, and select Regional Rural Banks which are eligible under the scheme.
data.funding_mechanism: The Applicant will get a credit guarantee after approval of the application and in case of default by the applicant, it will be provided directly to the Bank subject to fulfilment of conditions.
data.additional_info: The Extent of the Guarantee Coverage The Trust shall provide a Guarantee as under for guarantees approved on or after December 01, 2022 (excluding enhancement of existing working capital account already covered under the Guarantee Scheme).
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Udyam Registration Certificate 
2. Business Plan (Business model, promoter profile, and projected financials) 
3. CGTMSE loan application Form 
4. Passport-sized photographs 
5. Business incorporation letter / Company registration certificate 
6. Business Project Report 
7. CGTMSE Loan Coverage Letter 
8. Copy of loan approval from the Bank 
9. CIBIL Report 
10. Other basic KYC documents
data.checklist_info_d:
